comment.author: 40714992@N04
comment._content: Agreed... looks like the photo is flipped, perhaps Company B.

comment.author: 17046340@N00
comment._content: Looks like there were only 7 corporals in company B, according to this site: www.usgennet.org/usa/nh/topic/civilwar/nh15thcob.htm Francis CHANDLER, Corpl. enlisted Sept 9 1862, age 18; claimed residence Piermont; mustered out Concord, NH. Aug 13 1863; last reported residence Chicago, IL. Cyrus R. CORLISS, Corpl., enlisted Sept 8 1862; age 25; claimed residence Plymouth; mustered out Concord, NH. Aug 13 1863; died Clinton, IA. March 28 1924. Charles W. DEARBORN, Corpl. enlisted Sept 9 1862, age 28; claimed residence Thornton; mustered out Concord, NH. Aug 13 1863; last reported residence Campton Village, NH. Absalom FORD, Corpl. enlisted Sept 5 1862, age 22; claimed residence Piermont; died of disease Memphis, TN. Aug 4 1863. Frank H. GEORGE, Corpl. enlisted Sept 8 1862, age 22; claimed residence Plymouth; mustered out Concord, NH. Aug 13 1863; last reported residence Concord, NH. Robert M. MCCLUER, Corpl. enlisted Sept 4, 1862, age 24; claimed residence Groton; mustered out Concord, NH. Aug 13 1863; last reported residence Penny, KS. Samuel S. MITCHELL, Corpl. enlisted Sept 17 1862, age 21; claimed residence Campton; mustered out Concord, NH. Aug 13 1863; last reported residence Campton, NH.

comment._content: Wow...150 years ago!

comment.author: 48017461@N08
comment._content: This is a beautiful collection of work. Thank you for sharing This with us...................:)

comment.author: 48623697@N00
comment._content: His regiment apparently was only constituted for a year, taking part in sieges of Confederate port towns in '63. There's a brief history of the 15th NHV on wikipedia.

comment.author: 30048877@N00
comment._content: Why is he holding a kepi? That's a French military hat.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Thanks to all for your comments on this image!  We will look into expanding the descriptive information in the record.

comment.author: 17046340@N00
comment._content: There's more on the 15th NHV at a free google book here: books.google.com/books?id=YRVCAAAAIAAJ&lpg=PA54&o... If you can find any more photos of the men listed above, you may be able to rule out some names and eventually get your man! (Looks like Samuel Mitchell, McClure and George are ruled out, there are pics of them there!) 3 down, 4 to go!

comment.author: 54995718@N05
comment._content: Co. B. 15th New Hampshire Volunteers is what I'm seeing.

comment.author: 93451833@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/30048877@N00] It is actually a forage cap which is a derivative of the kepi, which was also popular. French fashion, especially with the military, was the norm for this period.

he looks *so* young!  so serious and so young. 

awesome facial hair tho.

comment.author: 81494713@N00
comment._content: Yes, so young and serious -- heartbreaking.  It would be wonderful to identify him.
